required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.official_title: Comparison of Vasodilative Effects Between Sevoflurane and Desflurane Using Peripheral Perfusion Index

brief_summary.textblock: The aim of this study is to compare the peripheral perfusion index values produced by equi-MAC of sevoflurane and desflurane in patients undergoing single-agent inhalation anesthesia.

detailed_description.textblock: Ether derivative anesthetics, including sevoflurane and desflurane, have direct activity on vascular tissue and both are vasodilators. However, there has been no direct comparison of vasodilative effect between sevoflurane and desflurane in vivo in humans. Peripheral perfusion index derived from photoplethysmographic waveform reflects peripheral vasomotor tone. Therefore, the purpose of this study is to compare the peripheral perfusion index values produced by sevoflurane and desflurane at equipotent concentration in patients undergoing single-agent inhalation anesthesia.

primary_outcome.time_frame: After a 30-min waiting period from the induction of anesthesia
primary_outcome.description: peripheral perfusion index value at a steady-state anesthesia of age-corrected 1.0 MAC

secondary_outcome.time_frame: After a 30-min waiting period from the induction of anesthesia
secondary_outcome.description: mean arterial pressure at a steady-state anesthesia of age-corrected 1.0 MAC

secondary_outcome.time_frame: After a 30-min waiting period from the induction of anesthesia
secondary_outcome.description: heart rate at a steady-state anesthesia of age-corrected 1.0 MAC

intervention.description: End-tidal concentration of sevoflurane is maintained at age-corrected 1.0 minimum alveolar concentration throughout the study period.
End-tidal concentration of desflurane is maintained at age-corrected 1.0 minimum alveolar concentration throughout the study period.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- patients aged between 19 and 65 yr
- patients with American Society of Anesthesiologists physical status classification I or II
- patients scheduled for elective arthroscopic knee surgery under general anesthesia
- patients obtaining written informed consent
Exclusion Criteria:
- patients with a history of any disease associated with the autonomic nervous system
- patients receiving any medication affecting the sympathetic or parasympathetic nervous systems
- patients with cardiac arrhythmia, diabetes mellitus, and alcohol or drug abuse
- pregnant women
